questions.question: They have been informed by us. We …………………………… them.
questions.description: The active verb in the present perfect has the form: have/have + past participle.

questions.question: The milk was drunk by the cat. The cat …………………………. the milk.
questions.description: Was drunk is the passive form of drank.

questions.question: The missing child has been found. They ………………………….. the missing child.
questions.description: Has been found is the passive form of has/have found.

questions.question: The injured were taken to hospital. They …………………………… the injured to hospital.
questions.description: Were taken is the passive form of took.

questions.question: The winners were praised by all. All people ………………………………. the winners.
questions.description: Were praised is the passive form of praised.

questions.question: The hall is being decorated. They ……………………………… the hall.
questions.description: Is being decorated is the passive form of is/are decorating.

questions.question: The man was bitten by the dog. The dog ……………………….. the man.
questions.description: Was bitten is the passive form of bit.

questions.question: A large house is owned by her. She ……………………………. a large house.
questions.description: Is owned is the passive form of own/owns.

questions.question: A laptop was bought by her. She ………………………….. a laptop.
questions.description: Was bought is the passive form of bought.

questions.question: The match will be won by us. We …………………………….. the match.
questions.description: Will be won is the passive form of will win.

questions.question: The house is being built. They ……………………………. the house.
questions.description: Is being built is the passive form of is/are building.

questions.question: It is being investigated. We …………………………………. it.
questions.description: Is being investigated is the passive form of is / are investigating.
